poem:
**Inching Forward**

Russian boots advance,  
fields whisper past conflicts,  
Sumy waits—a silent  
winter's breath in the north,  
mothers cradle memories,  
count miles like beads  
on rosaries. Shadows twist  
along roads, old scars  
in the soil, nights taut  
with history, futures still  
woven in the loom of iron,  
fragile as snowflakes  
falling unseen.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
